channel.title: Stove! Please Anyone? Help!
channel.description:
[center]
Server:TorvaPkz
Sorry to you guys that have all ready seen my Thread i posted but i still cant seem to fix the problem. Does Anyone know how i can fix this? or maybe get in contact with me to spare a couple of minutes of your time fixing this stove problem. Spent hours on end trying to fix this problem.
Skype:haviland41
Thanks Josh
[img]http://i43.tinypic.com/6dreol.png[/img][/center]

item.title: Stove! Please Anyone? Help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

See this:
loadCustomSpawns©;
find the loadCustomSpawns(Client c) method in ObjectHandler or ObjectManager (Should be in the ‘world’ folder)

Read full topic

item.title: Stove! Please Anyone? Help!
item.dc:creator: @enahsh2o enahsh2o
item.description:
@enahsh2o wrote:

[quote=“haviland4, post:9, topic:528802”]i agree but i have no idea how to change the cache.
Need someone to help me thanks Josh
Skype:haviland41

loadCustomSpawns©;
if (c.distanceToPoint(43423, 232,) <= 60) {
c.getFarming().updateHerbPatch();

Found this where abouts do i add that text to?[/quote]

You should be able to put it anywhere under the loadCustomSpawns. I know for myself I have it separated nice and neatly because that is the way I am. Where I have a ‘removing’ section and an ‘adding’ section with multiple sub sections. :o
The person before you might have been the same maybe look for a //removing or something of the sorts.
If you can’t figure it out copy and paste the whole custom spawns section on here.

Docent:

Maybe it’s a standard (not custom added) object. I’d suggest getting a different cache.

It is a standard object, that stove is there on RS but it can be removed the same way. o.O It might not be the best way to take care of the problem but it should do the trick. If I knew how to take care of it another way I would gladly offer my advice but I don’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Stove! Please Anyone? Help!
item.dc:creator: @enahsh2o enahsh2o
item.description:
@enahsh2o wrote:

Get the coords for the stove and go to ObjectManager.java.
Find

loadCustomSpawns

Then add

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(-1, xxxx, xxxx, 0, 0);

The -1 gets rid of the object, the ‘xxxx, xxxx’ are the x and y coords for the object.
You might need to change the last 0 to 10. Not sure but you can try both ways.

Read full topic
